intro: Galium spurium var. genuinum, commonly known as the true bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is often covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
